TopicTitle: Complete Science Spreadsheet. Every planet and moon. Every biome. Every experiment.

Articles.Content:
I made a comprehensive science spreadsheet. It should include every possible experiment/biome combination. For Crew Report, EVA Report, Mystery Goo, Materials Bay, Thermometer and Barometer, for some planets they are once per biome at a certain altitude and once per planet at a different altitude. In those cases, for the instances where it's once per planet, simply fill it in for the first biome of that body and it will be automatically copied to all the other biomes, so you only need to fill it in the one time you do it.

And of course, check my work. I used another spreadsheet somebody had made for Kerbin biomes as a starting point and celem's checklist as a reference for the rest of the system, but I noticed I had temperature readings his checklist said shouldn't have been possible. I adjusted that, but if there's anything else that you catch, please let me know.

Here it is!
You should include the nose cone sciencey thingy

That's "Atmospheric Analysis." I tried to give them the same names that they have in the Science Archives, for ease of record keeping.

Edited January 25, 2014 by Yossarian22

Just found this--very handy. Thanks! loaded it up in openoffice. Now what I'd love to know is what constitutes low space and high space for each planet and the sun. I was thinking of doing a sun mission as it seems it gives a lot of science points, but just how close do I have to get to it (given how I keep missing the Mun...think I got the trick now though...it seems a lot harder to miss the sun )
